properties.description: The number of body rows at the beginning of the table in which to skip border stroke formatting. Note: Valid when start row stroke count is 1 or greater and/or end row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: skipFirstAlternatingStrokeRows

properties.description: The number of body rows at the end of the table in which to skip border stroke formatting. Note: Valid when start row stroke count is 1 or greater and/or end row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: skipLastAlternatingStrokeRows

properties.description: The number of rows in the first alternating row strokes group.
properties.name: startRowStrokeCount

properties.description: The color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of row borders in the first alternating row strokes group. Note: Valid when start row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startRowStrokeColor

properties.description: The stroke weight of row borders in the first alternating row strokes group. Note: Valid when start row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startRowStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of rows in the first alternating strokes group. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: startRowStrokeType

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the borders in the first alternating row strokes group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when start row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startRowStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the gap color of the row border stroke in the first alternating row strokes group will overprint. Note: Valid when start row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startRowStrokeGapOverprint

properties.name: startRowStrokeGapColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the gap color of row borders in the first alternating rows group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when start row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startRowStrokeGapTint

properties.description: If true, the row borders in the first alternating row strokes group will overprint. Note: Valid when start row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startRowStrokeOverprint

properties.description: The number of rows in the second alternating row strokes group.
properties.name: endRowStrokeCount

properties.description: The stroke color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of row borders in the second alternating row strokes group. Note: Valid when end row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endRowStrokeColor

properties.description: The stroke weight of row borders in the second alternating row strokes group. Note: Valid when end row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endRowStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of rows in the second alternating strokes group. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: endRowStrokeType

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the row borders in the second alternating strokes group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when end row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endRowStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the rows in the second alternating rows group will overprint. Note: Valid when end row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endRowStrokeOverprint

properties.name: endRowStrokeGapColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the gap color of rows in the second alternating strokes group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when end row stroke count is 1 or greater and end row stroke type is not solid.
properties.name: endRowStrokeGapTint

properties.description: If true, the gap of the row borders in the second alternating rows group will overprint. Note: Valid when end row stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endRowStrokeGapOverprint

properties.description: The number of columns on the left of the table in which to skip border stroke formatting. Note: Valid when start column stroke count is 1 or greater and/or end column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: skipFirstAlternatingStrokeColumns

properties.description: The number of columns on the right side of the table in which to skip border stroke formatting. Note: Valid when start column stroke count is 1 or greater and/or end column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: skipLastAlternatingStrokeColumns

properties.description: The number of columns in the first alternating column strokes group.
properties.name: startColumnStrokeCount

properties.description: The stroke color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of column borders in the first alternating column strokes group.

properties.description: The stroke weight of column borders in the first alternating column strokes group. Note: Valid when start column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startColumnStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of columns in the first alternating strokes group. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: startColumnStrokeType

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of column borders in the first alternating column strokes group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when start column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startColumnStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the column borders in the first alternating column strokes group will overprint. Note: Valid when start column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startColumnStrokeOverprint

properties.description: The stroke gap color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of column borders in the first alternating column strokes group. Note: Valid when start column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startColumnStrokeGapColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the gap color of column borders in the first alternating column strokes group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when start column stroke count is 1 or greater.

properties.description: If true, the gap of the column borders in the first alternating column strokes group will overprint. Note: Valid when start column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: startColumnStrokeGapOverprint

properties.description: The number of columns in the second alternating column strokes group.
properties.name: endColumnStrokeCount

properties.description: The stroke color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of column borders in the second alternating column strokes group. Note: Valid when end column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endColumnStrokeColor

properties.description: The stroke weight of column borders in the second alternating column strokes group. Note: Valid when end column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endColumnStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of columns in the second alternating strokes group. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: endColumnLineStyle

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of column borders in the second alternating column strokes group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when end column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endColumnStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the column borders in the second alternating column strokes group will overprint. Note: Valid when end column stroke count is 1 or greater.
properties.name: endColumnStrokeOverprint

properties.description: If true, hides alternating row fills. If false, hides alternating column fills.
properties.name: columnFillsPriority

properties.description: The number of body rows at the beginning of the table to skip before applying the row fill color. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: skipFirstAlternatingFillRows

properties.description: The number of body rows at the end of the table in which to not apply the row fill color. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: skipLastAlternatingFillRows

properties.description: The fill color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of rows in the first alternating fills group. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: startRowFillColor

properties.description: The number of rows in the first alternating fills group. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: startRowFillCount

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the rows in the first alternating fills group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: startRowFillTint

properties.description: If true, the rows in the first alternating fills group will overprint. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: startRowFillOverprint

properties.description: The number of rows in the second alternating fills group. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: endRowFillCount

properties.description: The fill color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of rows in the second alternating fills group. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: endRowFillColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the rows in the second alternating fills group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: endRowFillTint

properties.description: If true, the rows in the second alternating fills group will overprint. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table rows.
properties.name: endRowFillOverprint

properties.description: The number of columns on the left side of the table to skip before applying the column fill color. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: skipFirstAlternatingFillColumns

properties.description: The number columns on the right side of the table in which to not apply the column fill color. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: skipLastAlternatingFillColumns

properties.description: The number of columns in the first alternating fills group. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: startColumnFillCount

properties.description: The fill color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of columns in the first alternating fills group. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: startColumnFillColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the columns in the first alternating fills group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: startColumnFillTint

properties.description: If true, the columns in the first alternating fills group will overprint. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: startColumnFillOverprint

properties.description: The number of columns in the second alternating fills group. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: endColumnFillCount

properties.description: The fill color, specified as a swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink), of columns in the second alternating fill group. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: endColumnFillColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the columns in the second alternating fills group. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: endColumnFillTint

properties.description: If true, the columns in the second alternating fills group will overprint. Note: Valid when alternating fills are defined for table columns.
properties.name: endColumnFillOverprint

properties.description: The header placement.
properties.name: breakHeaders

properties.description: The footer placement.
properties.name: breakFooters

properties.description: If true, skips the first occurrence of header rows.
properties.name: skipFirstHeader

properties.description: If true, skips the last occurrence of footer rows.
properties.name: skipLastFooter

properties.description: The order in which to display row and column strokes at corners.
properties.name: strokeOrder

properties.description: The pattern for alternating fills.
properties.name: alternatingFills

properties.description: The contents to place in cells, specified as an array whose first item populates the top left cell and whose second item populates the next cell to the right, and so on until each cell in the top row is populated, at which point the next item populates the left-most cell in the second row, and so on. Note: If the array contains fewer strings than the table contains cells, the remaining cells are left blank. Can return: Array of Strings or SpecialCharacters enumerators. Can also accept: Array of Strings, SpecialCharacters enumerators or NothingEnum enumerators.
properties.name: contents

properties.description: A property that can be set to any string.
properties.name: label

properties.description: The number of body rows.
properties.name: bodyRowCount

properties.description: The number of columns.
properties.name: columnCount

properties.description: The name of the Table; this is an alias to the Table's label property.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The table style applied to the table. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: appliedTableStyle

properties.description: The direction of the the table
properties.name: tableDirection

properties.description: If true, then the table will show collapsed in story and galley views.
properties.name: displayCollapsed

properties.description: Specifies the order the table cells will display in when viewing in story and galley views.
properties.name: displayOrder

properties.description: A property that allows setting of several properties at the same time.
properties.name: properties

parameters.name: reverseOrder

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)

parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.description: Deletes the Table.
methods.name: remove

methods.description: Unmerges all merged cells in the Table.
methods.name: unmerge

methods.description: Converts the table to text.

parameters.description: The character to insert between the each column's content in the converted text. Note: Can be defined as any single character, such as a letter, number, or punctuation mark, or by typing a space or tab. Use the actual character rather than its name, such as ',' rather than 'Comma'. Precede double or single quotes or a backslash with an extra backslash as an escape character. For paragraphs, use ^p. (Optional)
parameters.name: columnSeparator

parameters.description: The character to use to separate each row's content in the converted text. Note: Can be defined as any single character, such as a letter, number, or punctuation mark, or by typing a space or tab. Use the actual character rather than its name, such as , rather than Comma. Precede double or single quotes or a backslash with an extra backslash as an escape character. For paragraphs, use ^p. (Optional)
parameters.name: rowSeparator

methods.name: convertToText

methods.description: Sets the label to the value associated with the specified key.

parameters.description: The key.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The value.
parameters.name: value

methods.name: insertLabel

methods.description: Gets the label value associated with the specified key.

parameters.description: The key.
parameters.name: key

methods.name: extractLabel

methods.description: Clear Table Style Overrides
methods.name: clearTableStyleOverrides

methods.description: Convert bullets and numbering to text.
methods.name: convertBulletsAndNumberingToText

methods.description: Selects the object.

parameters.name: existingSelection
parameters.description: The selection status of the Table in relation to previously selected objects. (Optional)

methods.name: select

methods.description: Converts text to outlines. Each line of text becomes a polygon object. When the converted text is a single letter that has no internal spaces or detached parts, the polygon contains only a single path. Note: To determine whether a font allows the creation of outlines, see allow outlines.

parameters.name: deleteOriginal
parameters.description: If true, deletes the original text. If false, creates the outlines as separate object(s) on top of the text.  (Optional)

methods.name: createOutlines

methods.description: Generates a string which, if executed, will return the Table.
